item.title: 美国法官裁定摩根大通客户可就现金清算利率过低提起诉讼
item.description: 摩根大通必须面对部分拟议集体诉讼，联邦法官裁定，该诉讼指控这家美国最大银行向经纪账户和退休账户持有人支付接近零利率的闲置现金利息，而非市场利率。【原文：JPMorgan Chase must face part of a proposed class action lawsuit accusing the largest U.S. bank of paying brokerage and retirement account holders near-zero interest rates instead of market rates on their idle cash, a federal judge ruled.】

item.title: Instacart股价飙升，乐观预测缓解市场对竞争的担忧
item.description: 在线杂货配送公司Instacart周五股价一度飙升19%，这家数百万美国人的首选购物平台发布了乐观的一季度业绩预期，缓解了市场对其面临日益激烈竞争的担忧。【原文：Instacart's shares surged as much as 19% on Friday after the online grocery delivery company, a go-to for millions of Americans, issued an upbeat first-quarter forecast that eased worries about growing competition.】

item.title: 欧莱雅首席执行官称，在开云集团与科蒂公司推进交易之际，欧莱雅倾向于优先获得古驰美妆授权。
item.description: 欧莱雅首席执行官尼古拉·希罗尼穆斯周五表示，公司希望能在2028年前获得古驰美妆品牌授权，并补充称该问题正在古驰母公司开云集团与现任授权方科蒂公司之间进行磋商。【原文：L'Oreal would welcome gaining access to the Gucci beauty licence earlier than 2028, CEO Nicolas Hieronimus said on Friday, adding that the issue was being discussed between Gucci-owner Kering and current licence holder Coty.】

item.title: 从软件到房地产，美国各行业正深陷人工智能恐慌交易的漩涡
item.description: 华尔街正深陷人工智能引发的颠覆性担忧。最初投资者抛售软件公司股票，但很快蔓延至被视为易受自动化冲击的行业，导致本周美股大幅下挫。【原文：Wall Street is in the grip of disruption worries from AI. It first started with investors dumping shares of software companies but soon spread to sectors seen as vulnerable to automation, driving sharp losses in U.S. stocks this week.】

item.title: 欧盟考虑采取双轨制打破经济改革僵局
item.description: 欧盟各国政府长期以来宣扬团结是应对中美经济压力的最佳对策，但如今发现亟需提升欧洲竞争力，而等待全部27个成员国达成共识可能耗时过久。【原文：EU governments have long preached unity as the best response to U.S. and Chinese economic pressure, but are discovering they need urgently to boost Europe's competitiveness and that waiting for all 27 member states to agree may take too long.】

item.title: 智利国家铜业公司（Codelco）在调查后更换了埃尔滕尼恩特矿的高管团队
item.description: 智利国有企业科德尔科公司——全球最大的铜生产商——周五宣布，在对埃尔特尼恩特矿山致命坍塌事故的调查结果公布后，将更换部分高管。【原文：Chile's state-run Codelco, the world's largest copper producer, announced on Friday it was replacing some executives following the results of an investigation into a deadly mine collapse at its El Teniente mine.】

item.title: 美国允许石油巨头重启委内瑞拉业务，基本批准新能源投资
item.description: 美国周五放宽了对委内瑞拉能源领域的制裁，颁布两项通用许可证，允许全球能源公司在该欧佩克成员国恢复油气业务，并允许其他公司就新能源业务投资合同进行谈判。【原文：The U.S. eased sanctions on Venezuela's energy sector on Friday, issuing two general licenses that allow global energy companies to resume oil and gas operations in the OPEC member and for other companies to negotiate contracts on investments in new energy operations.】

item.title: 据消息人士透露，Vista Equity正寻求以10亿美元以上价格出售AlertMedia。
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Vista Equity Partners正考虑以10亿美元以上的价格出售其旗下紧急通讯软件供应商AlertMedia。【原文：Vista Equity Partners is exploring a $1 billion-plus sale of its emergency communications software provider AlertMedia, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国商务部初步支持西班尼-斯蒂尔沃特公司对俄罗斯钯征收关税的呼吁
item.description: 西班尼-斯蒂尔沃特公司周五表示，其呼吁美国对俄罗斯钯进口征收关税的提议已获得美国商务部的初步支持，但最终决定预计要到2026年年中才会作出。【原文：Sibanye-Stillwater's call for U.S. tariff on Russian palladium imports has received preliminary support from the U.S. Commerce Department, although a final decision is not expected until mid-2026, the miner said on Friday.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称美联储拟任命前华尔街律师盖恩担任银行监管要职
item.description: 据两位知情人士透露，美国联邦储备委员会预计将任命兰德尔·盖恩担任新的监管总监，这位与华尔街渊源深厚、在银行业关系广泛的资深人士将执掌监管行业的重要职位。【原文：The U.S. Federal Reserve is expected to name Randall Guynn as its new director of supervision and regulation, said two people familiar with the matter, putting a Wall Street veteran with deep banking ties in a powerful position policing the industry.】

item.title: 高盛首席执行官向CNBC表示，他"不情愿地接受了"律师鲁姆勒的辞职。
item.description: 高盛集团首席执行官大卫·所罗门周五向CNBC表示，他虽不情愿但已接受首席法律官凯西·鲁姆勒的辞职，并强调尊重她的离职决定。【原文：Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon said he had reluctantly accepted Chief Legal Officer Kathy Ruemmler's resignation, he told CNBC on Friday and stressed that he respected her decision to leave.】

item.title: 加拿大航空公司表示，随着美加贸易紧张局势加剧，海外商务旅行需求激增。
item.description: 加拿大航空公司一位高管周五表示，随着该国寻求摆脱对美国的贸易依赖，企业海外出行量激增近30%，这推动了国际旅行需求。【原文：Air Canada sees a near 30% surge in corporate traffic flowing overseas as the country seeks to diversify trade away from the United States, fueling demand for international travel, a company executive said on Friday.】

item.title: 美国1月消费者价格涨幅低于预期
item.description: 数据显示，美国1月份消费者价格涨幅低于预期，这使得美联储今年降息的计划得以推进。【原文：U.S. consumer prices increased less than expected in January, data showed, keeping the Federal Reserve on track to cut interest rates this year.】

item.title: 美国利率期货显示，在通胀数据公布后，美联储六月放松政策的可能性上升。
item.description: 美国利率期货小幅上调了美联储6月降息的可能性，此前数据显示1月份通胀涨幅低于预期。【原文：U.S. interest rate futures slightly raised odds of rate cuts by the Federal Reserve in June after a report that showed inflation rose less than expected in January.】

item.title: 分析师称PJM计划或将加速数据中心电力交易
item.description: 分析师表示，美国最大电网运营商PJM互联公司为应对数据中心激增的电力需求而制定的计划，可能加速数据中心所有者与独立电力生产商之间的交易达成。【原文：A plan from PJM Interconnection, the largest power grid operator in the U.S., to manage burgeoning power demand from data centers could accelerate deal-making between data-center owners and independent power producers, analysts said.】

item.title: Pinterest股价暴跌，因关税拖累大客户广告支出
item.description: 周五盘前交易中，图片分享平台Pinterest股价暴跌逾20%，此前该公司表示，由于关税引发的不确定性导致美国大型零售商削减广告支出，其季度营收预期受到冲击。【原文：Pinterest shares plummeted over 20% in premarket trading on Friday after the image-sharing platform said its quarterly revenue forecast was hit by large U.S. retailers scaling back ad spending due to tariff-induced uncertainty.】

item.title: Rivian股价飙升，即将上市的平价SUV推动电动汽车交付预期
item.description: Rivian预计其低价车型今年将吸引更多买家，推动该公司股价周五飙升24%，这再次表明电动汽车制造商正押注平价车型以重振销量——此前一项关键联邦补贴政策已到期。【原文：Rivian's projection that its cheaper models would attract more buyers this year powered a 24% stock jump on Friday, the latest sign of electric vehicle makers betting on affordable cars to revive sales after a key federal subsidy expired.】

item.title: 施罗德出售案使更多欧洲基金管理公司成为收购目标
item.description: 英国历史悠久的基金管理公司施罗德本周决定向美国资产管理公司纽文出售资产，这凸显了欧洲竞争对手在快速整合的全球行业中面临的严峻抉择：要么扩大规模，要么出售资产。【原文：Historic British fund manager Schroders' decision this week to sell up to U.S. asset manager Nuveen highlights the stark choice facing European rivals struggling to compete in a rapidly consolidating global industry: bulk up or sell out.】

item.title: 美国消费者价格涨幅低于预期
item.description: 美国1月份消费者价格涨幅低于预期，但随着企业年初提价，潜在通胀有所增强。加之劳动力市场趋于稳定，美联储可能在一段时间内维持利率不变。【原文：U.S. consumer prices increased less than expected in January, but underlying inflation firmed as businesses raised prices at the start of the year, which together with a stabilizing labor market could allow the Federal Reserve to keep interest rates unchanged for a while.】

item.title: 对冲基金在Wegovy对决前大举押注Hims & Hers Health，Hazeltree数据显示
item.description: 对冲基金做空Hims & Hers Health的仓位在1月份达到至少一年来的最高水平，就在这家在线远程医疗公司与诺和诺德就其低价减肥药发生冲突之前。Hazeltree向路透社提供的数据显示。【原文：Hedge fund bets against Hims & Hers Health hit their highest in at least a year in January, just before the online telehealth firm clashed with Novo Nordisk over its cut-price weight-loss pill, according to data shared with Reuters by Hazeltree.】

item.title: 中国表示，在荷兰对恩智浦半导体案作出裁决后，确保半导体供应链稳定是首要任务。
item.description: 中国商务部周五在官网声明中表示，恢复全球半导体供应链稳定是当前首要任务。该声明是对荷兰法院本周早些时候针对恩智浦半导体公司裁决的回应。【原文：Restoring stability to global semiconductor supply chains is the top priority, China's commerce ministry said Friday in response to a Dutch court ruling earlier this week on Nexperia, according to a statement published on the ministry's website.】

item.title: 独家：Stellantis在欧洲各地重启柴油车生产，电动汽车退潮之际
item.description: 据路透社对经销商网站及公司声明的梳理，菲亚特-克莱斯勒汽车公司正悄然在欧洲复产至少七款轿车及乘用车型的柴油版本，同时逐步退出电动汽车领域。【原文：Fiat-to-Jeep owner Stellantis is quietly resurrecting diesel versions of at least seven car and passenger van models across Europe as it retreats from electric vehicles, according to a review of dealer websites and company statements to Reuters.】

item.title: 消息人士称，美国预计将阿里巴巴等公司列入涉嫌协助中国军方的企业名单
item.description: 据两位知情人士透露，特朗普政府最早将于周五将阿里巴巴等公司列入涉嫌协助中国军方的企业名单。【原文：The Trump administration is expected to add companies, including Alibaba , to a list of firms allegedly aiding China's military as soon as Friday, two people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 贝森特表示国会应在今年春季通过加密货币监管法案
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特·贝森特周五表示，国会通过一项法案制定数字资产的联邦规则至关重要，该法案需在今年春季提交总统唐纳德·特朗普签署生效。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Friday that it was important for Congress to pass a bill to create federal rules for digital assets and get it onto President Donald Trump's desk to sign into law this spring.】

item.title: 世界杯与软饮为大型啤酒商带来曙光，此前2025年曾遭遇"惨淡"局面
item.description: 大型啤酒商及其股东正寄望于2026年带来转机，押注足球世界杯赛事和转向软饮料业务能帮助他们克服地缘政治动荡、注重健康的Z世代年轻人以及生活成本危机带来的挑战。【原文：Big brewers and their shareholders are hoping for some 2026 cheer, betting soccer's World Cup and a pivot to soft drinks can help overcome challenges from geopolitical turbulence, health-conscious Gen Z youth and cost of living crises.】

item.title: 大众汽车表示，在特朗普废除气候政策后，其转型承诺不变。
item.description: 大众汽车周五表示，尽管注意到美国总统特朗普近期对气候法规的调整，但该公司仍长期致力于推进更高效、低排放的汽车发展路线。【原文：Volkswagen remains committed to its course towards more efficient and low-emission vehicles in the long term, the German carmaker said on Friday, taking note of a recent change to U.S. climate regulation under President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 贝森特称参议院银行委员会同意推进对美联储提名人沃什的听证会
item.description: 财政部长斯科特·贝森特周五表示，尽管有位关键参议员对提名持保留态度，参议院银行委员会仍将推进对唐纳德·特朗普总统提名的美联储主席人选凯文·沃什的确认听证会。【原文：The Senate Banking Committee will proceed with confirmation hearings for Kevin Warsh, President Donald Trump's pick to head the Federal Reserve, despite a key senator's hold on the nomination, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Friday.】

item.title: 莫德纳季度营收超预期，得益于新冠疫苗销售韧性
item.description: 莫德纳公司周五公布的第四季度营收超出华尔街预期，这得益于其新冠疫苗在美国市场的销售表现优于预期。【原文：Moderna reported fourth-quarter revenue above Wall Street estimates on Friday, banking on better-than-expected sales of its COVID-19 vaccine in the U.S.】

item.title: 晨间竞价：暗夜之舞
item.description: 迈克·多兰和ROI团队本周末最期待阅读、观看和收听的内容。【原文：Everything Mike Dolan and the ROI team are excited to read, watch and listen to over the weekend.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称欧佩克+倾向于4月起恢复增产
item.description: 据三位OPEC+消息人士透露，该组织正倾向于从4月起恢复增产计划，以应对夏季用油高峰。当前油价因美伊关系紧张而获得支撑。【原文：OPEC+ is leaning towards a resumption in oil output increases from April, three OPEC+ sources said, as the group prepares for peak summer demand and price strength is bolstered by tensions over U.S.-Iran relations.】
